newsitem.title: USA: Novell, IBM offer gateway products.
newsitem.headline: Novell, IBM offer gateway products.

text.p: Novell Inc. said it and International Business Machines Corp. will Tuesday unveil a new version of Novell's gateway product for IBM's AS/400 line of midrange computers.

A Novell spokesman said the company views what it calls the host-connectivity business, which links various established computer systems, as a $50 million to $60 million revenue opportunity which also serves to promote sales of Novell's Intranetware and other products.

The product, dubbed IntranetWare for SAA AS/400 Edition 2 enables customers to integrate their existing systems' new applications to deploy Internet technologies across local area networks, the company said.

Last week, Novell said it has incorporated its Novell Directory Services (NDS) product into IBM's RS/6000 workstations and S/390 mainframe systems. NDS enables companies to connect and manage diverse networked systems.

David Holbrook, product line manager for host connectivity products at Novell, said the products "help customers that have an investment in IBM minicomputers and mainframes to integrate those with local area networks."
For example, a person could print a report originally designed to print on an AS/400 dedicated printer on other types of machines.
IntranetWare will be available immediately in English, French, German, Italian, Portuguese and Spanish priced from $995 for a five-user package to $7,695 for a 100-user package.
